newsitem.title: UK: NWE gasoline eases on weaker crude in quiet market.
newsitem.headline: NWE gasoline eases on weaker crude in quiet market.

text.p: NWE gasoline eased on Tuesday in quiet trade.
"It's fairly quiet. We're in a new month and people are busy deciding their positions but there's not much physical activity," one trader said.
Eurograde barges traded at $199 fob ARA in late trade, having been done at $200 in early trade. Many sellers said they were not interested in prices below $200.
Traders said a combination of weak crude prices, high gasoline stocks in the region and insipid demand was likely to pressure prices lower.

"With this lovely weather we may expect consumption to rise a bit. I would expect to see some German end-user demand, but until the high stock positions many of us had ahead of Easter are cleared the market's unlikely to rise that much," said one trader in the ARA region.
Few expected prices to remain on the wane for long, saying that players would not want to maintain short positions with the U.S. driving season just around the corner.
On the swaps front, an April paper was done at 202, while May paper traded at $202.75.
An April cargo swap was rumoured done at $209 cif NWE, but this was not confirmed.
The arbitrage window to the United States was not quite open, traders said. "It's touch and go on the arb front. We've cargoes going over but that's material we organised weeks ago," one said.
